title: Scotland Re-formed, 1488–1587
a good general introduction
Ireland in the Age of the Tudors, 1447–1603: English Expansion and the End of Gaelic Rule
a comprehensive synthesis
English Reformations: Religion, Politics, and Society under the Tudors

note: Alford, Burghley: William Cecil at the Court of Elizabeth I (London, 2008), a startling look not just at Elizabeth’s chief minister but at his influence in the 1550s.
title: The Later Tudors: England, 1547–1603
a detailed overview of the second half of the period
Earthly Necessities: Economic Lives in Early-Modern Britain, 1470–1750
socio-economic history with a human face, highly readable

note: focusing especially on cross-border subterfuge and the triangulation of politics between William Cecil, Elizabeth, and Mary.
title: My Heart is My Own’: The Life of Mary Queen of Scots

note: The Tragedy of Katherine, Mary and Lady Jane Grey (London, 2008), readable and up to date.
title: the best short revisionist life
The Life and Death of Anne Boleyn: The Most Happy
not just a life of Anne, but a guide to Henry’s way of thinking as well. Leanda de Lisle, The Sisters who would be Queen
a useful short study
Thomas Cranmer: A Life
an outstanding life, full of insights especially into Edward VI’s reign

note: conveys thrillingly the dark side of Henry VII’s character.
title: The Dawn of Tudor England

note: an excellent short life aimed at students.
title: Mary Tudor
a classic biography, still as lively and fresh as ever
a highly readable life: accurate and informative
Henry: Virtuous Prince
the early life of Henry VIII, but also a political history of Henry VII’s reign

container-title: Studies of special topics Simon Adams, Leicester and the Court: Essays in Elizabethan Politics
title: the most useful life for students
Soul of the Age: The Life, Mind and World of William Shakespeare
an exhilarating tour of the intellectual and cultural world that shaped and informed Shakespeare’s thinking

container-title: Policy and Police: The Enforcement of the Reformation in the Age of Thomas Cromwell
note: the authoritative study of Cromwell’s role in the break with Rome. S. Gunn and P. Lindley (eds), Cardinal Wolsey: Church, State and Art (Cambridge, 1991), especially good on art and buildings.
title: The Elizabethan Puritan Movement
a virtuoso study of the Protestant dilemma after the 1559 settlement
Monarchy and Matrimony: The Courtships of Elizabeth I
an excellent analytical account of Elizabeth’s matrimonial diplomacy
The Stripping of the Altars: Traditional Religion in England, 1400–1580
includes an evocative account of the Catholic liturgical tradition on the eve of the Reformation
Fires of Faith: Catholic England under Mary Tudor
argues that England under Mary was the closest thing in Europe to a laboratory experiment for the Counter-Reformation
The Children of Henry VIII
shows how their childhoods and educations shaped their lives and how their interrelationships were often scarred by jealousy, mutual distrust, Further reading sibling rivalry, even hatred

note: a reassessment of gender in politics.
title: a forensic study of the legends that circumscribe Elizabeth
The Heart and Stomach of a King: Elizabeth I and the Politics of Sex and Power

author.literal: R. Rex, Henry VIII and the English Reformation (London

title: excellent for students
Selling the Tudor Monarchy: Authority and Image in Sixteenth-Century England
a comprehensive account of art and iconography
Six Wives: The Queens of Henry VIII
a dramatic, discriminating account of Court politics

container-title: A. Walsham, Church Papists: Catholicism, Conformity and Confessional Polemic in Early Modern England
title: The Crisis of the Aristocracy
still the most important (if controversial) study of high society. S. Thurley, The Royal Palaces of Tudor England: Architecture and Court Life, 1460–1547
a path-breaking academic study
